casebody.data:
No. 29 THE CITY OF NEWARK, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. THE NATIONAL SILK DYEING COMPANY, DEFENDANT-RESPONDENT. THE CITY OF NEWARK, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. THE WEIDMANN SILK DYEING COMPANY, DEFENDANT-RESPONDENT. No. 30 Argued November 9 and 10, 1922 Decided March 13, 1923.

Before Justices Kalisch, Black and Katzenbach.

Per Curiam.

The judgments in the above two cases Fos. 29 and 30'are affirmed, for the reasons stated in the opinion in Fo. 21, the Acquackanonk Water Co. v. the Weidmann Silk Dyeing Co.

The judgments of the Passaic Circuit Court are affirmed.

Note.—See Acquackanonk Water Co. v. Weidmann Silk Dyeing Co., Adv. R., p. 248.
